Abra.Description: Using its ability to read minds, it will sense impending danger and teleport to safety.

Arbok.Description: The pattern on its belly is for intimidation. It constricts foes when they are frozen in fear.

Arcanine.Description: Its proud and regal appearance has captured the hearts of people since long ago.

Beedrill.Description: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

Blastoise.Description: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

Bulbasaur.Description: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

Butterfree.Description: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

Caterpie.Description: It releases a stench from its red antenna to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.

Charizard.Description: It is said that Charizard's fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

Charmander.Description: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

Charmeleon.Description: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

Clefable.Description: It is very wary and rarely shows itself to people. Its ears can hear a pin drop over half a mile away.

Clefairy.Description: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

Diglett.Description: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

Dratini.Description: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

Dugtrio.Description: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.

Eevee.Description: Because its genetic makeup is irregular, it quickly changes its form due to a variety of causes.

Ekans.Description: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.

Fearow.Description: It has the stamina to fly all day on its broad wings. It fights by using its sharp beak.

Flareon.Description: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1,600 degrees.

Gastly.Description: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

Geodude.Description: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

Gloom.Description: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

Golbat.Description: Its sharp fangs puncture the toughest of hides and have small holes for greedily sucking blood.

Golduck.Description: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.

Growlithe.Description: A Pokémon with a loyal nature. It will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.

Gyarados.Description: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

Horsea.Description: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

Ivysaur.Description: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower's coming bloom.

Jigglypuff.Description: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.

Jolteon.Description: Every hair on its body starts to stand sharply on end if it becomes charged with electricity.

Kakuna.Description: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

Magikarp.Description: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

Magnemite.Description: Uses antigravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.

Mankey.Description: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

Meowth.Description: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

Metapod.Description: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

Mew.Description: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.

Nidoking.Description: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

Nidoqueen.Description: Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will protect the young in its burrow with its life.

NidoranF.Description: While it does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the poison it secretes from its barbs can be fatal.

NidoranM.Description: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

Nidorina.Description: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino's.

Nidorino.Description: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.

Ninetales.Description: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.

Oddish.Description: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.

Omanyte.Description: This Pokémon from ancient times is said to have navigated the sea by adeptly twisting its 10 tentacles.

Omastar.Description: Once wrapped around its prey, it never lets go. It eats the prey by tearing at it with sharp fangs.

Paras.Description: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.

Parasect.Description: A mushroom grown larger than the host's body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.

Persian.Description: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.

Pidgeot.Description: By flapping its wings with all its might, Pidgeot can make a gust of wind capable of bending tall trees.

Pidgeotto.Description: It flies over its wide territory in search of prey, downing it with its highly developed claws.

Pidgey.Description: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

Pikachu.Description: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

Primeape.Description: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.

Psyduck.Description: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.

Raichu.Description: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

Raticate.Description: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.

Rattata.Description: Cautious in the extreme, its hardy vitality lets it live in any kind of environment.

Sandshrew.Description: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.

Sandslash.Description: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.

Snorlax.Description: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.

Spearow.Description: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

Squirtle.Description: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

Vaporeon.Description: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's

Venomoth.Description: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.

Venonat.Description: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

Venusaur.Description: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.

Vileplume.Description: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

Voltorb.Description: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

Vulpix.Description: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.

Wartortle.Description: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.

Weedle.Description: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

Wigglytuff.Description: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.

Zubat.Description: It checks its surroundings and location using reflections of the ultrasonic waves from its mouth.
